title: Jonah Goldberg: Trump’s best defense against impeachment is to admit he did it and apologize
text:
We’re 100 percent certain that President Trump isn’t going to take Jonah Goldberg’s advice to just admit there was a quid pro quo with Ukraine’s president and apologize, but hey, it’s an option to consider.

Trump did it. Everyone knows he did it. Pretending otherwise will get him impeached for sure. Admitting it and apologizing at least reduces the chances he’ll be impeached and would improve the chances of senate GOP in 2020. https://t.co/0kE2tDbFO0 — Jonah Goldberg (@JonahDispatch) October 30, 2019

Can we just say that we don’t think Rep. Adam “Pencil Neck” Schiff is looking for an apology down in his top-secret bunker?

Goldberg writes at National Review:

In l’affaire Ukraine, the president is guilty as charged. And the best strategy for him to avoid impeachment by the House and perhaps even removal by the Senate is to admit it, apologize, and let voters make their own judgment. It’s also the best way to fend off a disaster for Senate Republicans. … This is why the smartest Trump defenders are counseling the president to simply admit the obvious: There was a quid pro quo, and the president’s phone call fell short of perfection, but nothing he did is an impeachable offense. … I disagree with those who say that the allegations against Trump are not impeachable. But, politically, apologizing could forestall impeachment by giving politicians and voters a safe harbor: “It was wrong, but he said he’s sorry. Move on.” The longer the president defends a lie, the more Americans will resent being lied to.

So, what do you think? Bill Clinton asked the country for forgiveness and liberated his supporters to say the country should “move on.”

I am a fan, and frequently cited your columns as the most eloquent and forceful reasons to be #NeverTrump in 2015. So it is not easy for me to say that this take is total and utter bullsh!t. But it is. #ImpeachmentForWHAT — (((L.N. Smithee))) (@LNSmithee) October 30, 2019

It is the height of sophistry to suggest that the dishonest, clandestine process led by #Pelosi & #Schiff and promoted 24/7 by a corrupt media majority should be rewarded by a #Trump "apology" for a crime that neither you nor anybody else is able to specify. #ImpeachmentForWHAT — (((L.N. Smithee))) (@LNSmithee) October 30, 2019

I said many times in the Obama era that as much as I thought he was the worst POTUS of my lifetime, calls for his impeachment were nonsensical because you shouldn't remove a CIC simply for sucking at the job. That's what elections are for. But as #Pelosi told Stephanopoulos 1/2 — (((L.N. Smithee))) (@LNSmithee) October 30, 2019

back on 10/3/19, "the re-election of Donald Trump would do irreparable damage to the United States," so she will unapologetically abuse the process to accomplish that. You may want to encourage her and #Schiff, Jonah. I will not. 2/2 https://t.co/gCOVwsCGFG #ImpeachmentForWHAT — (((L.N. Smithee))) (@LNSmithee) October 30, 2019

Yeah, considering they’ve been plotting Donald Trump’s impeachment even before he was inaugurated, we don’t know as an apology would soften any hearts in The Resistance.
